intro: Fumaria mairei subsp. mairei, commonly known as the Maire's fumitory, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Fumariaceae. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm. The plant produces delicate, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, often in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs. Native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe, it thrives in well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade.
